result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 years probation; conditions of probation DNA sample; any counseling deemed appropriate by agent - the court encourages anger management; fine/costs totaling $654.00; no contact with Jordan Peiffer; restitution to Sawyer County in the amount of $505.55.  If the county has already been paid by Jordan Peiffer then the restitution amount shall be paid to Jordan Peiffer.

miscConds.notes: $404.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$505,55  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$250.00  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  The court encourages anger management.
NO CONTACT directly or indirectly with Jorand Peiffer his family, property, place of residence or employment.

records.addlTxt: To DA on Petition for Sentence Adjustment

Defendant Robert L. Kirk in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Robert L. Kirk in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CT 171, 16 CT 160, 16 CM 239 and 16 TR 801.  STATE 16 CM 239 amend to remove repeater.  Court grants motion to delete repeater.  DE entered plea of NC.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds DE guilty 16 CT 171 and 16 CM 239   /   16 CT 160, 16 CT 149 are dismissed and read-in and 16 TR 801 is dismissed

COURT:  14 CF 49:   3 1/2 years prison:   18 months  in custody and  2 years  extended supervision with credit of 94 days - costs will continue as previously ordered

16 CT 171:  Fine/Costs $579.00 given 60 days to pay or set up payment plan after released from prison

16 CM 239:  9 months county jail concurrent to 14 CF 49 -  costs $453.00 given 60 days to pay or set up payment plan after released from prison: 16 CT 160, 16 CT 149 are dismissed and read-in

16 CT 160: DRI

16 TR 801: Dismissed

16 CT 149: DRI
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 31, 2016 at 09:30 am.
of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Robert L. Kirk in court with attorney James Jay Rennicke.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to facts; jaoint recommendation; victim notification completed; PSI waived;  Defendant pleads NC to CT 1; court finds G and convicts on CT1; CT 2 is dismissed and read in.  Sentenced to 3 years probation; conditions of probation DNA sample; any counseling deemed appropriate by agent - the court encourages anger management; fine/costs totaling $654.00; no contact with Jordan Peiffer; restitution to Sawyer County in the amount of $505.55.  If the county has already been paid by Jordan Peiffer then the restitution amount shall be paid to Jordan Peiffer.  Report to probation today.
